citation.article-title: Mesorhizobium ciceri biovar biserrulae, a novel biovar nodulating the pasture legume Biserrula pelecinus L.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Mesorhizobium ciceri biovar biserrulae
Mesorhizobium ciceri biovar biserrulae is named after the legume host, Biserrula pelecinus L., with which these bacteria form a nitrogen-fixing symbiotic relationship.
Gram-negative rods (0.5×1 μm) with a polar or subpolar flagellum and containing granules of poly-β-hydroxybutyrate.
They are moderately fast-growing, forming 2–4 mm diameter colonies within 4–5 days on YMA, and have a mean generation time of 4–6 h when grown in YMB at 28 °C.
Colonies on YMA are white–opaque, slightly domed, moderately mucoid with smooth margins.
Strains grow on YMA containing 1.5 % (w/v) NaCl, but not with 2.0 % (w/v) NaCl, and are able to tolerate a pH range between 5.5 and 8.0.

Utilizes the following compounds as sole sources of carbon: glycerol, erythritol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-xyloside, galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, aesculin, cellobiose, melibiose, β-gentiobiose, d-turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol and l-arabitol.

Cannot utilize the following compounds as sole sources of carbon: methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, amygdalin, inulin, melezitose, glycogen, xylitol, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate and 5-ketogluconate.

Strains are sensitive to (μg ml−1) ampicillin (50), chloramphenicol (40), spectinomycin (50) and tetracycline (20) while they are resistant to gentamicin (40), kanamycin (50), nalidixic acid (50) and streptomycin (100).
The G+C content of the DNA is 62.7 mol%.

Symbiotic genes of this organism are located on a mobile symbiosis island and it is able to nodulate B. pelecinus and Astragalus membranaceus, while strains do not nodulate Cicer arietinum (Nandasena et al., 2004).
